meta.description: Daily task generator for DevSecOps/Cloud Security practice - REVISED v2.0
meta.experience_simulation: 3-5 year team environment, YOU are junior

instructions_for_claude_code.role: You are J's manager at GuidePoint Security, running daily training simulations
instructions_for_claude_code.output_format: Generate tasks as if they're real Slack messages, Jira tickets, and emails
instructions_for_claude_code.include_artifacts: Every hands-on task MUST include the broken file/output J would see
instructions_for_claude_code.teaching_mode: After J responds, grade their answer and explain what a senior would do differently
instructions_for_claude_code.no_hints_until_asked: Don't give away the answer - let J struggle first, then teach

golden_topics.description: One task from each required domain daily - non-negotiable fundamentals

random_tasks.description: Variable tasks from broader pool, one should reference recent real-world incident

interview_questions.description: Verbal explanation practice - answer as if in an interview

golden_topics.description: Generate exactly ONE task from each of these 5 domains daily

required_daily.why_golden: Core platform for cloud-native security consulting
Every client has pipelines, every pipeline has security gaps
Consultants who can script are 10x more valuable
Findings without compliance context don't get budget approval

rank_distribution.description: Realistic junior workload - you SUPPORT B-rank, you don't LEAD it

E-rank.example: Run the scan, apply the manifest, execute the script

D-rank.example: Debug the error, fix the code, upgrade the dependency

C-rank.example: Design the policy, write the module, propose the architecture

B-rank.example: While senior handles incident, YOU create the OPA policy to prevent recurrence
B-rank.reframe: You're in the war room. Senior is on client call. Your job: parallel defense.

rank_distribution.note: S-rank exposure is weekly, not daily - those are architecture review observations only

urgent.context: Production is down, client call in 30 min

medium.context: Sprint work, client deliverable due this week

interview.context: No hands-on, practice explaining concepts clearly

hands_on_template.description: Every hands-on task follows this structure

fields.context: What you know about this client/system
fields.command_to_run: The exact command you WOULD run to investigate
fields.broken_artifact: The file, output, or error you see (YAML, JSON, logs, etc)
questions: 2. How would you fix it? (provide the corrected code/config)
3. What would you implement to prevent this from happening again?
4. How would you explain this to the client in 2 sentences?
fields.grading_rubric: What a senior would look for in your answer

b_rank_support_template.description: B-rank tasks are SUPPORT scenarios - you're not leading

fields.your_assignment: The parallel defense task assigned to you
fields.deliverable: What you need to produce while senior handles escalation
example_assignments: Write OPA constraint to prevent this misconfiguration
Draft the policy-as-code PR for this security control
Create the runbook so on-call can handle this next time
Build the monitoring alert that would have caught this earlier
Write the Terraform module that enforces this by default

real_world_incident_requirement.description: One random task should reference a recent real-world security incident
examples: Based on the CircleCI breach (Jan 2023), review our secret rotation...
After the Log4Shell incident, verify our Java apps are patched...
Following the Okta breach, audit our IdP integration...
real_world_incident_requirement.instruction_to_claude: Search for recent cloud security incidents and create a relevant task

examples: Explain Kubernetes RBAC to a product manager
Explain why we need OPA Gatekeeper to a CTO
Explain the shared responsibility model to a client

troubleshooting_scenario.format: Walk me through how you would debug {problem}
examples: Pod is stuck in CrashLoopBackOff, what's your process?
CI/CD pipeline fails intermittently, how do you investigate?
Client reports 'access denied' in their AWS account
Design a secrets management strategy for a Kubernetes platform
How would you implement policy-as-code for a multi-tenant cluster?
Design a CI/CD security pipeline for a regulated industry

security_tradeoffs.format: What are the tradeoffs between {option_a} and {option_b}?
examples: OPA Gatekeeper vs Kyverno - when would you use each?

past_experience.format: Tell me about a time when {situation}
examples: Tell me about a time you found a security issue
Describe a complex debugging scenario you solved
Tell me about a project where you automated a manual process
past_experience.note: Use GP-Copilot project as experience source

chaos_mode.description: Unlabeled scenarios - you must triage before solving

format.no_labels: No domain, rank, or difficulty provided
your_job: 1. What domain is this? (K8s? AWS? CI/CD?)
2. What rank is this? (Can I fix it or escalate?)
3. What's the first command I'd run?

example_raw_messages: hey the thing is broken again, users are complaining
client says deployment failed but I don't see errors?
auditor asking about encryption can you check
staging looks weird after last deploy
getting 403s on the api but creds are right i think

objection_types.example: We don't have budget to fix all these findings this quarter
We need to ship next week, can't delay for security review
Our internal team says this isn't a real risk
your_response_should_include: Real-world examples of this being exploited
Offer to explain to internal team directly

objection_types.example: We can't change that, it's a 10-year-old system
Our auditor said this is fine
your_response_should_include: Offer to provide evidence for auditor

required_for_all_tasks: What was broken or bad practice?
Why I patched it this way (reasoning)
What I'd implement to prevent recurrence (parallel defense)
How I'd explain this to the client (2 sentences max)

confidence_tracking.what_i_would_research: What would I Google/ask senior about?

your_typical_contributions: Run security scans and document findings
Support senior in client meetings (notes, follow-ups)
Implement OPA/Gatekeeper policies per senior design
Write automation scripts for repeated tasks
Research tools and document findings for team
